results.title: Kwaidan = Woman of the snow
results.creator_credit: Masaki Kobayashi, Shigeru Wakatsuki and Ninjin Club
results.brief_description: Director Masaki Kobayashi’s quartet of self contained ghost stories uses to spellbinding effect highly stylised sets, expressionistic lighting and painterly backdrops in the retelling of 19th century English Orientalist Lafcadio Hearn’s writings. ‘Kwaidan’s‘ (which translates to ghost story) eerie mood is sealed by its mesmerizing and modest credit sequence followed by the first story, the foreboding ‘Shadowings’. The next instalment, ‘Yuki Onna’ (Snow Woman) uses lurid lighting and its contrived studio sets to maximum dream-like effect, while ‘The story of Miminashi Hoichi’ incorporates various modes of ancient Japanese story telling with breathtaking results. Finally, ‘In a cup of Tea’s‘ grimly surreal coda of a publisher’s frustration with the inconclusiveness of many Japanese ghost stories, aptly completes this remarkable anthology. Kobayashi’s meticulous direction, (Kobayashi’s obsessive aesthetic control drove him to hand paint all the sets himself) along with the unsettling soundtrack by Toru Takemitsu make this a unique film experience. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Keiko Kishi, Tatsuya Nakadai, Kazuo Nakamura, Tetsuro Tamba and Rentaro Mikuni (Awards: Special Jury prize 1965 Cannes Film Festival)

results.title: The Linguini incident
results.creator_credit: Richard Shepard, Arnold Orgolini and Linguini Productions
results.brief_description: 2 women with unfulfilled dreams and 1 man with a gambling debt embark on a pact to rob a nightclub. Waitress Lucy (Rosanna Arquette) aspires to be Lucy the Ethereal, a female Houdini, but has not made a spectacular escape since childhood. Her friend, Viv (Eszter Balint), wants to create her own line of avant-garde lingerie but is finding it hard to make a start, and Monte (David Bowie) is a gambling addict who says he needs to marry before the end of the week or his life is in danger. Together, they rob the nightclub and Lucy agrees to marry Monte, however when the wedding falls through Monte loses yet another bet and it’s up to be Lucy to be Lucy the Ethereal once and for all to settle the accumulated $4 million dollar debt. Bowie’s real life wife, Iman, makes a cameo as a nightclub guest.

results.title: Highlander [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Russell Mulcahy, William N Panzer, Peter S. Davis and Highlander Productions
results.brief_description: From the dawn of time there has been the immortals, destined to live forever and compete for the ultimate prize, duelling against one another until there is only one left with power beyond imagination. Only decapitation can end their immortality. Set in contemporary Manhatten, this fantasy saga follows Highlander Connor Macleod (Christopher Lambert) in a battle against his eternal enemy and main contender for the prize, The Kurgan (Clancy Brown). After being arrested by the police for a fracas in an underground carpark which results in a headless body, Connor must also contend with the inundation of questions, and challenge the notion that immortals cannot fall in love. Connor discovers he is one of the immortals when he is “killed” during a battle in the Scottish highlands by The Kurgan, but miraculously does not die. He learns of his status by fellow immortal Ramirez (Sean Connery), who must cede his immortality by decapitation to make way for a superior contender to battle for the prize. This cult classic makes effective use of flashbacks between past and present and spawned many less superior sequels. Cast includes also Roxanne Hart, Beatie Edney and Alan North. Soundtrack by Queen.

results.title: Wild reeds = Les Roseaux sauvages
results.creator_credit: Andre Techine, Georges Benayoun, Alain Sarde, Canal+, Les Films Alain Sarde and Ima Films
results.brief_description: It is 1962 and at a boarding school in rural France two young men from vastly different worlds - Francois is an urban intellectual and Serge is a farmer’s son - begin a tentative friendship. Both boys find themselves attracted to Maite, their school teacher’s daughter, but Francois must also deal with the first awakening of homosexual desire for his best friend. Their innocence is shattered by the arrival of the Algerian born Henri who brings with him the militant racist anger of the colonial expatriate, an anger he directs against his fellow school mates and towards the Communist sympathising Maite. Techine’s “Wild reeds” is possibly the defining work of French cinema at the end of the twentieth century. In setting his story in the early sixties, Techine is both acknowledging the debt owed to the Nouvelle Vague (in particular to Truffaut), as well as firmly establishing through his mise-en-scene his debt to the older, neglected French tradition of directors such as Renoir, Carne and Clair. Even though the film itself is vastly enjoyable as a narrative of adolescent rites of passage, it can also be read as an attempt to re-interrogate the cultural and historical legacy of French decolonisation and of the generation of 1968; the generation whose work and ideologies were to overwhelm French cinema and aesthetics for over two decades. “Wild reeds”, like “La haine”, “World without pity” and “Irma Vep”, is a sign of the renewal of French cinema - the exploration of new terrain and the possible reconciliation of past struggles and disruptions. This is a wonderful film. The outstanding cinematography is by Jeanne Lapoirie. The cast include Elodie Bouchez, Gael Morel, Stephane Rideau and Frederic Gorny. (Awards: Winner of the Cesar for Best Film and Best Director, 1995)

results.title: Gidget goes Hawaiian
results.creator_credit: Paul Wendkos, Jerry Bresler, Jerry Bresler Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Francie Lawrence, better known as Gidget, is off on a Hawaiian holiday with her parents after being disappointed in love by her surfing boyfriend, Moondoggie. Gidget manages to conquer the boys on Waikiki with her good looks, dancing ability and naturally, her surfing prowess, but complications ensue when Moondoggie arrives unannounced. Gidget finds herself caught in a love triangle involving Moondoggie and newcomer dancing stud, Eddie Horner. Things get even worse when jealous rival, Abbey, starts a vicious rumour about Gidget having had “an unfortunate experience”, which causes an even bigger stir with her parents. Cast includes Deborah Walley, James Darren and Michael Callan.

results.title: Mystic pizza
results.creator_credit: Donald Petrie, Scott Rosenfelt, Mark Levinson and Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: Friends Kat, Daisy and Jojo share their insecurities, dreams and aspirations as they work at Mystic Pizza, a successful pizzeria in small town Mystic. Kat (Annabeth Gish) is sensible and intelligent, holding down 4 part time jobs to finance her way through next year’s astronomy course and about to become involved with a married man. Daisy (Julia Roberts in her first major screen role), Kat’s sister, is promiscuous and sexy, arguing with her mother who wants her to “calm down” and involved with rich kid Charlie in a possible rags to riches romance. Jojo (Lili Taylor) is engaged to fishmonger Bill but is suffering from pre-wedding jitters and her healthy libido is at odds with Bill’s catholic conscience. All three of them want to make something of their lives - perhaps get out of Mystic, and all three of them are determined to remain friends forever. Cast also includes William R Moses, Vincent D’Onofrio, Adam Storke and Conchata Ferrell.

results.title: The Fate of Lee Khan [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: King Hu, Golden Harvest and King Hu Film Productions
results.brief_description: A martial arts historical epic of deceit, vengeance, treachery and bloody retribution. In 1366 Yuan dynasty China is ruled by Mongol invaders. Lee Khan, a ruthless, decadent aristocrat and master swordsman, and his beautiful but heartless sister, attempt defend their corrupt legacy of privilege and power. They face defeat when group of Chinese national revolutionaries organize and wage a great uprising against their Mongolian oppressors. Cast includes Angela Mao, Hsu Feng, Roy Chiao. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Maidens in uniform = Girls in uniform = Madchen in uniform
results.creator_credit: Leontine Sagan, Carl Froelich and Deutsche Filmgemeinschaft
results.brief_description: Central to the film, set in a boarding school for the daughters of German officers prior to World War I, is the intense relationship between a young student and her female teacher. Interwoven emotional and institutional pressures result in near tragedy. The atmosphere of Prussian authoritarianism in the school is expertly evoked and the film has long been seen as an attack on German militarism and was suppressed by the Nazis. Causing an uproar on its release because of its frank handling of lesbianism, it was rediscovered in the seventies and has now taken its place as a classic of gay cinema. Director Leontine Sagan had been trained by Max Reinhardt and was already a prominent stage actress. Soon afterwards she came to England to direct a film for Alexander Korda. Cast includes Dorothea Wieck, Hertha Thiele, Emilia Unda and Ellen Schwannecke. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Of mice and men
results.creator_credit: Gary Sinise, Russ Smith and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: John Malkovich and Gary Sinise both deliver powerhouse performances in this adaptation of John Steinbeck’s classic tale of doomed friendship set in the Great Depression. Best friends Lennie (Malkovich) and George (Sinise) find themselves unemployed and unable to keep stable employment for long, due to Lennie’s infantile mental capacity. Their luck seems to change as they are hired at the Tyler Ranch, although they must endure the over-zealous supervision by the boss’s son, Curley (Casey Siemaszko). After settling in and making friends, their world is torn asunder by tragedy when Curley’s unhappy wife (Sherilyn Fenn) becomes the innocent victim of Lennie’s compassion.
results.description: John Malkovich and Gary Sinise both deliver powerhouse performances in this adaptation of John Steinbeck’s classic tale of doomed friendship set in the Great Depression. Their luck seems to change as they are hired at the Tyler Ranch, although they must endure the over-zealous supervision by the boss’s son, Curley (Casey Siemaszko). After settling in and making friends, their world is torn asunder by tragedy when Curley’s unhappy wife (Sherilyn Fenn) becomes the innocent victim of Lennie’s compassion.
description_for_label: John Malkovich and Gary Sinise both deliver powerhouse performances in this adaptation of John Steinbeck’s classic tale of doomed friendship set in the Great Depression. Best friends Lennie (Malkovich) and George (Sinise) find themselves unemployed and unable to keep stable employment for long, due to Lennie’s infantile mental capacity. Their luck seems to change as they are hired at the Tyler Ranch, although they must endure the over-zealous supervision by the boss’s son, Curley (Casey Siemaszko). After settling in and making friends, their world is torn asunder by tragedy when Curley’s unhappy wife (Sherilyn Fenn) becomes the innocent victim of Lennie’s compassion.

results.title: Jonathan Livingston seagull
results.creator_credit: Hall Bartlett, JLS Partnership and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Richard Bach’s best selling novel about spiritual development and human achievement is brought to life in this rendition, complete with a Neil Diamond soundtrack. The story begins with a flock of seagulls pecking at garbage left by a boat. One of these seagulls - Jonathan (voice supplied by James Franciscus), longs to soar above his current existence, reaching dizzying heights and be the fastest seagull. Thus he leaves the flock to see the world and in search of speed. On reaching aviary heaven he meets Maureen Seagull (voice supplied by Juliet Mills) who introduces Jonathan to new experiences. Jonathan returns to his flock with new found knowledge but the other seagulls are sceptical until he performs a miracle and Jonathan is elevated to a messianic hero. Voices also supplied by Philip Ahn, Richard Crenna, Kelly Harmon and Hal Holbrook.
